content.question: (a) Many initiatives and techniques contributed to the Green Revolution in the 1950s and 1960s, which increased worldwide agricultural production. One area that was affected by the Green Revolution was irrigation.(i) Identify one method of irrigation.

frqParts.text: (a) Many initiatives and techniques contributed to the Green Revolution in the 1950s and 1960s, which increased worldwide agricultural production. One area that was affected by the Green Revolution was irrigation.(i) Identify one method of irrigation.
(ii) Describe one environmental problem that can be caused by irrigation.

(b) Use of chemical pesticides also began to increase during the Green Revolution. In recent years, various approaches to using chemical pesticides have been used in agriculture. The graph below shows the use of three different chemical pesticides in Britain from 1994 to 2012. (i) Identify the total metric tons of pesticides used in 2010.
(ii) Based on the data in the graph, describe the trend shown in the graph for the use of Pesticide C from 2008 through 2012.

(iii) Describe one reason why Pesticide <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was used beginning in 2006 through 2012 rather than increasing the amount of Pesticide <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> from 2006 to 2012.
(iv) Propose a solution to decrease the total amount of chemical pesticides used in Britain for agriculture.

(v) Justify the solution you proposed in (<math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>b</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>)(<math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>iv</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) by explaining one of its potential advantages over chemical pesticides.

(c) The intensive agriculture strategies and methods of the Green Revolution have had some unintended negative consequences, such as decreased soil fertility or increased soil erosion over time. Sustainable agricultural strategies and methods can differ from the methods first used during the Green Revolution.(i) Identify and describe one sustainable agriculture strategy or method that can be used to maintain or increase soil fertility.
(ii) Propose a sustainable solution to reduce the amount of soil erosion from agricultural practices.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe environmental concepts and processes.
